options.value: HR Disciplinary, Conduct & Capability Quiz Challenge
options.name: title_text

string.Text: Closed captions. Press the spacebar to toggle captions on and off.
Skip navigation. Press enter to return to the slide.

links.slidetitle: Disciplinary, conduct and capability can mean different things, depending upon your perspective. Match the definitions to the correct labels.
links.displaytext: Disciplinary, conduct and capability can mean different things, depending upon your perspective. Match the definitions to the correct labels.

links.slidetitle: Misconduct is a serious matter, but less serious than Gross Misconduct. Select the option that best represents some of the examples that would only be classed as misconduct.
links.displaytext: Misconduct is a serious matter, but less serious than Gross Misconduct. Select the option that best represents some of the examples that would only be classed as misconduct.

links.slidetitle: So if Gross Misconduct is more serious than Misconduct  its important to be able to identify examples of Gross Misconduct. Select the option that best represents some of the examples that would be classed as Gross Misconduct.
links.displaytext: So if Gross Misconduct is more serious than Misconduct  its important to be able to identify examples of Gross Misconduct. Select the option that best represents some of the examples that would be classed as Gross Misconduct.

links.slidetitle: On many occasions informal action is a preferred before formal action. Read the descriptions provided below, and select the ones that you would deem more appropriate for informal, rather than formal action.
links.displaytext: On many occasions informal action is a preferred before formal action. Read the descriptions provided below, and select the ones that you would deem more appropriate for informal, rather than formal action.

links.slidetitle:
Case Study - Joanne: Read the transcript from the case study, and select what you believe to be the most appropriate option/action.
Jo has been with the business for 9 years and is a Customer Services Assistant at the bus station. You are the Bus Station Manager and today, Saturday 9th May, when arriving for work, Jo appears to be unsteady on her feet and you can smell alcohol on her breath. 
She is not in a fit state to clean or provide information to customers, what could you do?
links.displaytext:
Case Study - Joanne: Read the transcript from the case study, and select what you believe to be the most appropriate option/action.
Jo has been with the business for 9 years and is a Customer Services Assistant at the bus station. You are the Bus Station Manager and today, Saturday 9th May, when arriving for work, Jo appears to be unsteady on her feet and you can smell alcohol on her breath. 
She is not in a fit state to clean or provide information to customers, what could you do?

links.slidetitle:
Read the continuation transcript and select the most appropriate option. 

Following this incident and Jos suspension, you arrange to hold an investigation meeting with her and an HR Advisor is present for this.
Manager: Thanks for coming in today Jo. This is an investigation meeting following your suspension for being drunk, and as a result of this you were unable to fulfil your job role responsibilities whilst on duty on the 9th May. 
Staff Member - Jo: Im not happy about this. I wasnt drunk. I want to have someone with me, I didnt know this was going to be so formal or I would have brought someone with me.  
Manager: Errr, oh, you dont really need a representative do you? Itll take time to sort that out now.
links.displaytext:
Read the continuation transcript and select the most appropriate option. 

Following this incident and Jos suspension, you arrange to hold an investigation meeting with her and an HR Advisor is present for this.
Manager: Thanks for coming in today Jo. This is an investigation meeting following your suspension for being drunk, and as a result of this you were unable to fulfil your job role responsibilities whilst on duty on the 9th May. 
Staff Member - Jo: Im not happy about this. I wasnt drunk. I want to have someone with me, I didnt know this was going to be so formal or I would have brought someone with me.  
Manager: Errr, oh, you dont really need a representative do you? Itll take time to sort that out now.

links.slidetitle:
Read the continuation transcript, and select the most appropriate option. 
HR Advisor: You were advised in your letter that you could arrange to bring someone with you today. Do you want me to arrange a representative for you? 
Staff Member - Jo: Naahhhh - its OK, I suppose. 
Manager: We can adjourn the meeting at any time if you change your mind about having a Rep. Can you tell me about what happened on the 9th May. You know I suspended you because I was able to smell alcohol on you. You appeared unsteady on your feet and you were not able to talk coherently to customers.
Staff Member  Jo: I dont like to moan, I just get on with it, but the chemist said it was a bad case of flu and gave me some stuff to take. It knocked be sideways and I felt quite woozy with it.
Manager: What medicine had you taken that day?
Staff Member Jo: Cant remember, some medicine from a bottle and some of those sachets things.
links.displaytext:
Read the continuation transcript, and select the most appropriate option. 
HR Advisor: You were advised in your letter that you could arrange to bring someone with you today. Do you want me to arrange a representative for you? 
Staff Member - Jo: Naahhhh - its OK, I suppose. 
Manager: We can adjourn the meeting at any time if you change your mind about having a Rep. Can you tell me about what happened on the 9th May. You know I suspended you because I was able to smell alcohol on you. You appeared unsteady on your feet and you were not able to talk coherently to customers.
Staff Member  Jo: I dont like to moan, I just get on with it, but the chemist said it was a bad case of flu and gave me some stuff to take. It knocked be sideways and I felt quite woozy with it.
Manager: What medicine had you taken that day?
Staff Member Jo: Cant remember, some medicine from a bottle and some of those sachets things.

links.slidetitle:
Read the continuation transcript and select the most appropriate option.
Manager: I could smell alcohol on you strongly that day. Im going to ask you directly - did you drink before coming to work that day and were you under the influence of alcohol?
Staff Member - Jo: No I didnt. I mean, I might have a six pack of beer and few whiskies, but I only do this before work if Im on a late start that day.
Manager: That seems like a lot of alcohol, especially before work.
Staff Member - Jo: How long ago was your treatment and where was this?
Staff Member - Jo: 5 years ago, after my son died, at the Halifax Clinic. 
Manager: So what time is your last drink in the evening before starting an early shift?
Staff Member - Jo: About 12ish.
Manager: And if youre on a late shift?
Staff Member - Jo: I might go to the pub for my dinner and have a couple.
links.displaytext:
Read the continuation transcript and select the most appropriate option.
Manager: I could smell alcohol on you strongly that day. Im going to ask you directly - did you drink before coming to work that day and were you under the influence of alcohol?
Staff Member - Jo: No I didnt. I mean, I might have a six pack of beer and few whiskies, but I only do this before work if Im on a late start that day.
Manager: That seems like a lot of alcohol, especially before work.
Staff Member - Jo: How long ago was your treatment and where was this?
Staff Member - Jo: 5 years ago, after my son died, at the Halifax Clinic. 
Manager: So what time is your last drink in the evening before starting an early shift?
Staff Member - Jo: About 12ish.
Manager: And if youre on a late shift?
Staff Member - Jo: I might go to the pub for my dinner and have a couple.

links.slidetitle:
The case study continues with a Formal Hearing, but what are the key roles in a Formal Hearing? 
Select the one correct option from those provided.
links.displaytext:
The case study continues with a Formal Hearing, but what are the key roles in a Formal Hearing? 
Select the one correct option from those provided.

links.slidetitle:
A Formal Hearing has now been called. Read the transcript and select the most appropriate option. 
HR Advisor: Hi Jo. Thanks for attending. I can confirm this is a formal hearing in line with our Disciplinary, Conduct & Capability Policy, relating to the allegation that you arrived at work on 9th May under the influence of alcohol and this had a detrimental impact upon your performance at work. Im present to take notes and clarify any questions. 
I see you have brought your union representative today whose role will be to support you, but not answer any questions for you. You may ask for an adjournment at any time. 
Union Rep: Youre out of procedure here, and the meeting shouldnt be happening. 
Chair (Lisa): Please can you clarify what you mean?  
Union Rep: Well, as youre aware, the manager who suspends an employee shouldnt be the person who carries out an investigation. Furthermore, the investigation should not have taken place without representation, as stated in the Disciplinary policy.
links.displaytext:
A Formal Hearing has now been called. Read the transcript and select the most appropriate option. 
HR Advisor: Hi Jo. Thanks for attending. I can confirm this is a formal hearing in line with our Disciplinary, Conduct & Capability Policy, relating to the allegation that you arrived at work on 9th May under the influence of alcohol and this had a detrimental impact upon your performance at work. Im present to take notes and clarify any questions. 
I see you have brought your union representative today whose role will be to support you, but not answer any questions for you. You may ask for an adjournment at any time. 
Union Rep: Youre out of procedure here, and the meeting shouldnt be happening. 
Chair (Lisa): Please can you clarify what you mean?  
Union Rep: Well, as youre aware, the manager who suspends an employee shouldnt be the person who carries out an investigation. Furthermore, the investigation should not have taken place without representation, as stated in the Disciplinary policy.

links.slidetitle:
Case Study back story: The line Manager outlined the findings of her investigation and justification of proceeding on the grounds that there is reasonable belief that Jo was under the influence of alcohol whilst at work.  She stresses the impact of Jos actions with regard to H&S risks to herself, her colleagues and members of the public, together with potential damage to WYCAs reputation as this is a customer facing role.
Read the continuing transcript, and select the relevant appropriate options. 
HR: Do you feel this is a fair and accurate summary?
Staff Member - Jo: Well I .
Union Rep: I cant say this is fair - I wasnt at the investigatory meeting, remember.
HR:  Bo?
Staff Member - Jo: Well it seems OK
Chair:  Id like to ask you some questions now if thats OK Bo? Firstly, youve admitted that you do drink before you attend work when starting a late shift, is this correct?
Staff Member - Jo:   Well yes I ..
Union Rep: Id like you to show me where it states you cant drink in your own time!
links.displaytext:
Case Study back story: The line Manager outlined the findings of her investigation and justification of proceeding on the grounds that there is reasonable belief that Jo was under the influence of alcohol whilst at work.  She stresses the impact of Jos actions with regard to H&S risks to herself, her colleagues and members of the public, together with potential damage to WYCAs reputation as this is a customer facing role.
Read the continuing transcript, and select the relevant appropriate options. 
HR: Do you feel this is a fair and accurate summary?
Staff Member - Jo: Well I .
Union Rep: I cant say this is fair - I wasnt at the investigatory meeting, remember.
HR:  Bo?
Staff Member - Jo: Well it seems OK
Chair:  Id like to ask you some questions now if thats OK Bo? Firstly, youve admitted that you do drink before you attend work when starting a late shift, is this correct?
Staff Member - Jo:   Well yes I ..
Union Rep: Id like you to show me where it states you cant drink in your own time!

links.slidetitle:
The meeting draws to a close  see the remaining transcript. 
Chair:  Is there anything youd like to add before we adjourn?
Union Rep:  I would like to make a statement on behalf of my member:  Jo has worked for our company for 9 years with an unblemished record. She has a difficult and thankless job and following the tragic death of her son, did have alcohol related problems and managed to fulfil her role without any impact. Taking this into account, I would expect a company such as ours to be supporting Jo not punishing her!  Alcoholism is a disability and I would have expected a more supportive approach.
As you review your final selection consider, if alcholism is a disability and covered by the Equality Act, and if Occupational Health as a role to play.
links.displaytext:
The meeting draws to a close  see the remaining transcript.

Union Rep:  I would like to make a statement on behalf of my member:  Jo has worked for our company for 9 years with an unblemished record. She has a difficult and thankless job and following the tragic death of her son, did have alcohol related problems and managed to fulfil her role without any impact. Taking this into account, I would expect a company such as ours to be supporting Jo not punishing her!  Alcoholism is a disability and I would have expected a more supportive approach.
As you review your final selection consider, if alcholism is a disability and covered by the Equality Act, and if Occupational Health as a role to play.
